Detailed Report: https://oss-fuzz.com/testcase?key=5140635270512640

Project: libavc
Fuzzing Engine: libFuzzer
Fuzz Target: avc_dec_fuzzer
Job Type: libfuzzer_asan_libavc
Platform Id: linux

Crash Type: Heap-buffer-overflow READ 8
Crash Address: 0x611000001fa8
Crash State:
  ih264d_compute_bs_non_mbaff_thread
  ih264d_recon_deblk_slice
  ih264d_recon_deblk_thread
  
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)

Recommended Security Severity: Medium

Crash Revision: https://oss-fuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_asan_libavc&revision=201908170410

Reproducer Testcase: https://oss-fuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5140635270512640

Issue filed automatically.

See https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz/blob/master/docs/reproducing.md for instructions to reproduce this bug locally.

This bug is subject to a 90 day disclosure deadline. If 90 days elapse
without an upstream patch, then the bug report will automatically
become visible to the public.
This is fixed in internal version. Once aosp/master gets updated, this should get resolved.

ClusterFuzz testcase 5140635270512640 is verified as fixed in https://oss-fuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_asan_libavc&range=201909050145:201909060220

If this is incorrect, please file a bug on https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz/issues/new

This bug has been fixed for 30 days. It has been opened to the public.

- Your friendly Sheriffbot
